function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Lack of emphasis on hygiene and sanitation in urban planning and management","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate access to green space and nature resulting in poor mental and physical health","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Pca analysis linking ’green areas’, ’trees’, and ’citizens’ with ’nature’, ’man’, and ’to create’.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Thematic analysis identifying concepts related to governance, awareness, and benefits and services in the context of green spaces.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Relationship between visitation frequency and missing ugs","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Word matrix analysis revealing common terms related to nature and urbanization","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"High percentage of respondents lack a green view from the window, increasing the risk of limited access to natural environments.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Clear majority of respondents reported missing urban green spaces ugs during the period of closure, indicating a high demand for access to nature.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Frequent visitation of ugs during the covid-19 pandemic","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Perceptions of ugs during home quarantine","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased travel to green areas outside residence","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Preference for urban parks and crowded areas for physical exercise","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increase in non-essential activities and social interactions in green areas","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Significant correlations between travel distance and place of residence","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Differences in means of transportation to reach urban green spaces during the pandemic","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Changes in the type of green space visited during the pandemic containment period","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited use of outdoor spaces","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Changes in ugs visiting behavior during covid-19","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Traveling to ugs at varying distances","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High visitation rates to urban green spaces in croatia and slovenia","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Differences in travel distances to urban green spaces in different countries","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Variations in transportation methods to urban green spaces","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High percentage of female respondents in all countries","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Age differences in respondent distribution between countries","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High percentage of respondents with completed higher education in specific countries","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Contagious and infectious diseases spreading through close contact","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate data cleaning and filtering leading to incorrect analysis","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Failure to identify statistical differences in disease prevalence between countries and regions","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Data privacy and security risks associated with the collection and storage of open-ended responses.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Bias and subjectivity in the text mining analysis leading to skewed interpretations.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Unrestricted self-selected survey may lead to biased representation of the population.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Data collected through personal and professional networks may not be diverse or representative of the entire population.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Conclusions limited to the sampled population due to purposive sampling and internet survey administration.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Online questionnaire distribution to the general public during a pandemic","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Data collection concurrent with covid-19 pandemic","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Restrictions on ugs visitation during the pandemic","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rapid increase in positive cases due to initial allowance of outdoor activities leading to stricter restrictions.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dramatic increase in positive cases leading to strict limitations on outdoor activities and public spaces.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Changed relation between humans and public spaces","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Diversity of societies and cultures in study countries","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Differences in attitudes toward urban green spaces based on cultural background and environmental factors","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Changes in citizens’ behavior and perceptions of urban green spaces in response to external events","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased urbanization leading to overcrowding and density in cities","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of access to green spaces and natural environments","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of efficient utilization of proposed solution","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Assuming a given physical space and constraints based on basic mathematical shapes may not accurately reflect the complexities of a built environment.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Stricter social distancing requirements may not be the only constraints to consider in the design of built environments for disease propagation mitigation.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Feasible solutions for seating arrangements may not always be practical due to additional practical considerations such as space for food trolleys.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Complex geometry with non-convex convoluted structures creates challenges for optimization","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inability to effectively implement social distancing and other physical constraints in the built environment","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"}]}
